title: Notion Database Maker
overviewMarkdown:
# **Notion Database Maker**
This plugin allows users to create a Notion database with detailed properties and settings.

### ðŸ“ **User Setting Notes:**
#### ðŸ”§ **Set Up the Plugin Server:**
- A plugin server must be set up to use this feature. Follow the detailed guide to set up a plugin server on Render: [How to Deploy the Plugin Server on Render](https://docs.typingmind.com/plugins/plugins-server/how-to-deploy-plugins-server-on-render)

#### ðŸ”‘ **Set Up Your Notion API Key:**
- Go to the [Notion Integration Page](https://www.notion.so/profile/integrations) and create a new integration.
- Copy the key from the Integration Detail Page.
- Paste the key into the plugin's user settings:
  **Notion API Key:** `ntn_XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX`

For detailed instructions, visit the [Notion Integration API Documentation](https://developers.notion.com/docs/create-a-notion-integration)

#### ðŸ”— **Share Your Database with the Integration:**
- Open your database in Notion.
- Click the **â€œShareâ€** button in the top right.
- Select **â€œInviteâ€**, search for your integration name, and click **â€œInviteâ€** to grant access.

For detailed instructions, visit the [Notion API Connections Documentation](https://www.notion.com/help/add-and-manage-connections-with-the-api)

### ðŸ“Œ **Important Notes:**

#### âš ï¸ **Limitations:**
- The plugin does **not support** the following property types: Relation, Rollup, Verification, and Unique ID.
- The order of properties is not preserved based on user input, and you will need to manually drag-and-drop the properties to adjust their order.

#### ðŸ‘‰ **Rate Limits:**
- There are rate limits for Notion API requests. Learn more at [Notion API Rate Limits](https://developers.notion.com/reference/request-limits#rate-limits).
- There are size limits on certain parameters, as well as the depth of children in requests. Learn more at [Notion API Size Limits](https://developers.notion.com/reference/request-limits#size-limits)


### ðŸ’¡ **Example Usage**  
> Create an Inline Database named â€œTypingMind Employee Directoryâ€ under my Notion Page URL https://www.notion.so/TypingMind-18a6a66d6ac98006ad95f8f7d8130dad
>
> Description: The TypingMind Employee Directory is a simple tool to quickly find and connect with colleagues. It lets you search and filter employees by role, 
department, and more.
> Icon: ðŸ“‡
> Cover Image: https://t4.ftcdn.net/jpg/09/77/83/07/240_F_977830794_XM1TKUBF0rO6bnOHZTGWASrr73Yt8Lng.jpg
>
> Database Structure:
> 1. NameÂ (Title)
> 2. Attachments (Files)
> 3. Department (Select) - Options: Engineering, Marketing, Sales, HR, Finance, Operations, Customer Support, Design
> 4. Email (Email)
> 5. LinkedIn Profile (URL)
> 6. Location (Select) - Options: HQ - New York, Office - London, Office - Singapore, Remote - Domestic, Remote - International, Hybrid, Office - New York
> 7. Notes (Rich Text)
> 8. Performance Review Status (Status) - Options: Not started, In progress, Done
> 9. Phone (Phone Number)
> 10. Probation Passed (Checkbox)
> 11. Role (Select) - Options: Engineer, Manager, Designer, Analyst, Developer, Director, Coordinator, Specialist
> 12. Skills (Multi-select) - Options: Project Management, Programming, Data Analysis, Communication, Leadership, Design, Marketing, Sales, MLOps, FullStack
> 13. Start Date (Date)
> 14. Title by Years of Experience: Calculate the "Title by Years of Experience" based on the following conditions using a Notion formula:
> - If "Years of Experience" is exactly 0, the title should be "Fresher."
> - If "Years of Experience" is less than 3 but not 0, the title should be "Junior."
> - If "Years of Experience" is 3 or more, the title should be "Senior."
> 15. Years of Experience (Number)

openaiSpec.name: create_notion_database
openaiSpec.description: Creates a database in Notion with detailed properties and settings.

parent.description: Defines the parent where the database will be created.

type.description: The type of the parent object. Supports 'page_id' for databases created under a specific page

pageId.description: The Page ID or Page URL of the parent object in Notion. For example, in the URL https://www.notion.so/{PAGE_TITLE}-{PAGE_ID}, the page ID is the string after dash separator (-), which is {PAGE_ID}.

icon.description: The icon of the database can currently only be an emoji, which must be specified.

cover.description: Defines the cover image for the database, which can only use an external URL.

isInline.description: Specifies whether the database is created inline. The default value is false.

title.description: Defines the title of the page. Following rich_text property schema definition.

type.description: Type of the content, should always be 'text'.

content.description: The content of the text block.

italic.description: Indicates if the text is italicized. Default is false.

bold.description: Indicates if the text is bolded. Default is false.

color.description: The color of the text. Default is 'default'.

strikethrough.description: Indicates if the text has a strikethrough. Default is false.

underline.description: Indicates if the text is underlined. Default is false.

description.description: Defines the description of the page. Following rich_text property schema definition.

type.description: Type of the content, should always be 'text'.

content.description: The content of the text block.

italic.description: Indicates if the text is italicized. Default is false.

bold.description: Indicates if the text is bolded. Default is false.

color.description: The color of the text. Default is 'default'.

strikethrough.description: Indicates if the text has a strikethrough. Default is false.

underline.description: Indicates if the text is underlined. Default is false.

notionProperties.description: An array of property objects to define the page's properties following Notion's property schema. This field is required when operation is 'create' or 'update'. Otherwise, it should be an empty array.

propertyType.description: The type of the property (title, rich_text, number, select, status, multi_select, date, url, email, phone_number, checkbox, files, formula).

options.description: The available options for select or multi_select properties.

color.description: The color of the option.  If not specified, randomly assign colors to the options from the supported Notion colors.

format.description: The format for the number property (if applicable).

formula.description: The formula for a Notion formula-based property.

dateFormat.description: The date format for date properties, typically 'YYYY-MM-DD'.

userSettings.name: pluginServer
userSettings.label: Plugin Server
userSettings.description: The URL of the plugin server. For more details, refer to the documentation: https://docs.typingmind.com/plugins/plugins-server

userSettings.name: notionApiKey
userSettings.label: Notion API Key
userSettings.description: Enter your Notion Secret Key. You can create an integration from Notion at https://www.notion.so/profile/integrations
